Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary as existing laws already address speech crimes like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could suppress lawful discussions on social issues by targeting political beliefs contrary to the mainstream.
The threat of large fines to private companies will lead to excessive censorship.
The definitions of harm in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially stifling free speech.
There is a lack of trust in the government to use the bill justly without proper safeguards.
Notable Quotes: The bill’s primary purpose seems to be the eradication of political beliefs deemed contrary to the mainstream, at any given time.
The definitions contained in the draft bill are also outrageously vague and subjective.
The hope that this bill will be used only for good – when it can so easily be used for unjust censorship – I think is naïve.
